intro: Parthenium, commonly known as feverfew, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragweed, and is characterized by its small, yellow composite flowers. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional remedies for headaches and inflammation. However, it can also cause allergic reactions in some individuals due to its pollen.
